data.title: First look of 'Fighter': Shah Rukh Khan impressed to see Hrithik Roshan, Deepika Padukone & Anil Kapoor as IAF pilots
data.meta_description: Shah Rukh Khan wished good luck to Hrithik Roshan and Deepika Padukone for their upcoming film 'Fighter', directed by Siddharth Anand. He expressed his excitement regarding the first look of the film.
data.text:
Synopsis

Shah Rukh Khan wished good luck to Hrithik Roshan and Deepika Padukone for their upcoming film 'Fighter', directed by Siddharth Anand. He expressed his excitement regarding the first look of the film.

Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan never misses out on cheering for his co-stars and industry friends.

On Wednesday, the actor gave a shout-out to Hrithik Roshan and Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Fighter', which is set to hit the theatres in 2024. The movie is helmed by Siddharth Anand of 'War' and 'Pathaan' fame.

Wishing the cast and crew good luck, the actor was impressed to see Roshan, Padukone and Anil Kapoor's first look in the movie as Indian Air Force pilots. His tweet read, "Wow this threesome of Hrithik, Deepika and Anil is looking awesome. All the best Duggu and Sid. Keep winning the fights, both of u… with love."

On Independence Day, the makers of 'Fighter' unveiled a motion poster, featuring the trio, that opens with a runway shot.

In the trailer, the trio were dressed in pilot uniforms, wearing sunglasses and holding their helmets.

Sharing the first look on X (formerly known as Twitter), Roshan wrote, "#SpiritOfFighter | Vande Mataram! See you in the theatres on the eve of India’s 75th Republic Day. Fighter releases worldwide on 25th January 2024."

'Fighter' also stars Karan Singh Grover and Akshay Oberoi in pivotal roles. The aerial action film is scheduled to release in theatres on January 25, 2024. It marks the first on-screen collaboration between Roshan and Padukone.

Siddharth announced the film in 2021. It is the first project under his production house MARFLIX, a banner dedicated to action film-making in India, along with his wife Mamta Anand.

Meanwhile, Siddharth partnered with SRK for the first time for his comeback blockbuster 'Pathaan', which earned more than Rs 1,000 crore at the box-office. The film also starred Deepika Padukone and John Abraham in the lead roles. SRK is busy with director Atlee's action thriller 'Jawan', which will star Nayanthara, Vijay Sethupathi, Sanya Malhotra and Priyamani, among others.
